Articles.Content:
Just want some peoples opinions.

Having a little trouble with my current laptop and looking to get a new one.

I do not trust the reviews I have read since they seemed to be too positive. Not mentioning anything or only one minor negative thing.

I am going with a laptop since I live on a boat and really want to save some space. It will also be used as a backup to my main navigation system so I need to be able to move it near the helm.

I am somewhat computer literate but rather far from being an expert.

I tend not to play many games and the ones I do seem to rely on the CPU more so then the GPU. Games I tend to play KSP, management and strategy. My top games are KSP, Silent Hunter 3, Total War franchise, and ocassionally RPG games.

Thanks in advance for any advice and help.

Model specs, per Amazon so people don't have to guess and/or look it up:

  • 17.3" IPS FHD Screen w/ G-SYNC Hardware Technology.
  • NVIDIA GeForce GTX970M 3G GDDR5 Graphics w/ G-SYNC.
  • Intel Core i7-4720HQ 2.6 GHz (turbo to 3.6GHz). 16GB RAM.
  • 1 TB 7200 RPM Hard Drive + 256 GB PCIEG2 Solid-State Drive.
  • Dual Band 802.11 A/C. 10/100/1000 Gigabit Ethernet.
  • 4x USB 3.0, 1x Thunderbolt port, 1x HDMI, 1x VGA/Mini D-sub 15-pin, 1x SPDIF, 1x Headphone-out, 1x Mic-in.
  • DL DVD-RW/CD-RW Optical Drive. SDXC Card Reader.

Let discussion commence.

Edit: Price is $1809 USD for those who care.

Edited August 14, 2015 by ComradeWolfe
Added price.

I have an older G75 which I bought new three years ago. It's not a small laptop (I had trouble finding a suitable backpack for it at the time). I have been very happy with it, and when I get to the point where I need to replace it, I will most likely buy another.

Games I have played with good performance:

KSP (obviously).

FSX

Alien Isolation

GTA V

Wolfenstien The New Order

Far Cry 3

Crysis 1 & 2

It doesn't cope too well with ARMA3 or Elite Dangerous. I can play them but the graphics have to be tweaked down. A new shiny G75 should have no problems with them though.

Edited August 14, 2015 by Astronut

Model specs, per Amazon so people don't have to guess and/or look it up:

  • 17.3" IPS FHD Screen w/ G-SYNC Hardware Technology.
  • NVIDIA GeForce GTX970M 3G GDDR5 Graphics w/ G-SYNC.
  • Intel Core i7-4720HQ 2.6 GHz (turbo to 3.6GHz). 16GB RAM.
  • 1 TB 7200 RPM Hard Drive + 256 GB PCIEG2 Solid-State Drive.
  • Dual Band 802.11 A/C. 10/100/1000 Gigabit Ethernet.
  • 4x USB 3.0, 1x Thunderbolt port, 1x HDMI, 1x VGA/Mini D-sub 15-pin, 1x SPDIF, 1x Headphone-out, 1x Mic-in.
  • DL DVD-RW/CD-RW Optical Drive. SDXC Card Reader.

Let discussion commence.

Edit: Price is $1809 USD for those who care.

Thanks. Not sure why I did not include the specs.
It is not a subtle laptop, but I assume you are okay with that.

How Asus Rog g751jt-db73 Got Named:

*Employee finishing the product on his computer*

"Yep. Laptop's about done, all we need now is to nam-"

*Someone bashes Employee's head into the computer's keyboard at least 7 times, violently*

"WHY WOULD YOU DO THAT? NOW I'LL HAVE TO DELETE ALL THI-"

*Employee looks at the result of his head + keyboard + bashing + MS Word*

It's... BEAUTIFUL!

And this, gentlemen, is how that aberration of a name was born.

How Asus Rog g751jt-db73 Got Named:

*Employee finishing the product on his computer*

*Someone bashes Employee's head into the computer's keyboard at least 7 times, violently*

*Employee looks at the result of his head + keyboard + bashing + MS Word*

And this, gentlemen, is how that aberration of a name was born.

I could not find any negative user reviews on ASUS which I find rather odd. Having worked in customer service even a great product will have someone complaining about it even when it is working and performing as advertised.

I did find some negative reviews on amazon that went beyond just saying the product sucks for some of ASUS older models. Seems if I do not get a lemon from them the product will work great for years. However if there is a problem ASUS's customer service may be unresponsive and rather a pain to deal with.

I am just going to pull the trigger and get it from Amazon so at least if there is an issue whithin the first month I can deal with Amazon and return it.
